titles.title: Recognizing the 100th anniversary of the founding of the Harley-Davidson Motor Company, which has been a significant part of the social, economic, and cultural heritage of the United States and many other nations and a leading force for product and manufacturing innovation throughout the 20th century.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

action.text: Mr. Walden (OR) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 296.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/14/2003--Passed House without amendment. Recognizes the 100th anniversary of the Harley-Davidson Motor Company.
